title: Working with WFS/WMS Services
text: WFS (Web Feature Service) WMS (Web Map Service) standardized protocols serving georeferenced map data internet: WFS provides access actual geographic features geometry attributes WMS provides map images rendered geographic data

title: Working with WFS/WMS Services
text: use Argentum import WFS layers, ’re getting actual vector data can analyze manipulate R:
code: library(Argentum) library(sf)  # Get organization data org <- argentum_select_organization(search = "Buenos Aires")  # List available layers layers <- argentum_list_layers(org$Name)  # Import a specific layer sf_layer <- argentum_import_wfs_layer(org$WFS_URL, layers$Name[1])  # Now you can work with the data using sf functions st_crs(sf_layer)  # Check the coordinate reference system plot(sf_layer)    # Basic plot of the geometry

title: Working with WFS/WMS Services
text: importing data, can check capabilities service offers:
code: # Get capabilities document capabilities <- argentum_get_capabilities(org$WFS_URL)  # The capabilities document contains information about: # - Available layers # - Supported operations # - Coordinate reference systems # - Output formats

title: Working with WFS/WMS Services
text: Always implement proper error handling:
code: tryCatch({   # Attempt to import data   sf_layer <- argentum_import_wfs_layer(org$WFS_URL, layers$Name[1]) }, error = function(e) {   # Handle any errors that occur   message("Error importing layer: ", e$message) })

title: Working with WFS/WMS Services
text: working WFS services:
code: # Use appropriate timeout values for large datasets capabilities <- argentum_get_capabilities(   url = org$WFS_URL,   timeout = 60  # Increase timeout for slow connections )

title: Working with WFS/WMS Services
text: importing WFS data:
code: library(sf) library(dplyr)  # Check the data structure str(sf_layer)  # Basic statistics summary(sf_layer)  # Spatial operations sf_layer_transformed <- st_transform(sf_layer, 4326)  # Calculate areas if working with polygons if (all(st_geometry_type(sf_layer) %in% c("POLYGON", "MULTIPOLYGON"))) {   sf_layer$area <- st_area(sf_layer) }

title: Working with WFS/WMS Services
text: Argentum provides high-level functions, can also work WFS services directly:
code: # Example of constructing a custom WFS URL base_url <- org$WFS_URL query_params <- list(   service = "WFS",   version = "1.1.0",   request = "GetFeature",   typeName = layers$Name[1],   outputFormat = "application/json" )  # Build the URL query_url <- httr::modify_url(   url = base_url,   query = query_params )

title: Working with WFS/WMS Services
text: Common issues solutions: Increase timeout value Check internet connection Verify service availability Use argentum_list_layers() get exact layer names Check case sensitivity Verify layer still exists service Check supported output formats Verify coordinate reference systems Ensure data compatibility sf package

title: Working with WFS/WMS Services
text: Planned features future versions: Spatial filtering support Temporal queries WMS integration Caching mechanism Batch export capabilities

title: Working with WFS/WMS Services

title: Getting Started with Argentum
text: Argentum R package simplifies access WFS (Web Feature Service) WMS (Web Map Service) data various Argentine organizations. vignette guide basic usage package.

title: Getting Started with Argentum
text: can install development version Argentum GitHub:
code: # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("your-username/Argentum")

title: Getting Started with Argentum
text: first step see organizations available data: show data frame organizations WFS/WMS URLs.
code: library(Argentum)  # Get list of organizations organizations <- argentum_list_organizations() print(organizations)

title: Getting Started with Argentum
text: can select organization either interactively programmatically:
code: # Interactive selection selected_org <- argentum_select_organization()  # Search for specific organizations buenos_aires_org <- argentum_select_organization(search = "Buenos Aires")

title: Getting Started with Argentum
text: ’ve selected organization, can see layers provide:
code: # List available layers layers <- argentum_list_layers(selected_org$Name) print(layers)

title: Getting Started with Argentum
text: import specific layer:
code: # Import a specific layer sf_layer <- argentum_import_wfs_layer(   wfs_url = selected_org$WFS_URL,   layer_name = layers$Name[1] )  # Basic plot of the imported data plot(sf_layer)

title: Getting Started with Argentum
text: guided experience, use interactive import function: guide process step step.
code: sf_layer <- argentum_interactive_import()

title: Getting Started with Argentum
text: Argentum includes robust error handling. ’s use :
code: tryCatch({   sf_layer <- argentum_import_wfs_layer(     wfs_url = "http://example.com/wfs",     layer_name = "example_layer"   ) }, error = function(e) {   message("Error occurred: ", e$message) })

title: Getting Started with Argentum
text: detailed information working WFS WMS services, see “Working WFS/WMS Services” vignette:
code: vignette("argentum", package = "Argentum")

title: Authors and Citation
text: Thomas Artopoulos. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Artopoulos T (2025). Argentum: Access Import WMS WFS Data Argentine Organizations. https://github.com/thomasartopoulos/argentum, https://thomasartopoulos.github.io/argentum/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {Argentum: Access and Import WMS and WFS Data from Argentine Organizations},   author = {Thomas Artopoulos},   year = {2025},   note = {https://github.com/thomasartopoulos/argentum, https://thomasartopoulos.github.io/argentum/}, }

what: Access and Import WMS and WFS Data from Argentine Organizations
title: Access and Import WMS and WFS Data from Argentine Organizations
text: Provides functions retrieve information Web Feature Service (WFS) Web Map Service (WMS) layers various Argentine organizations import R analysis. WFS WMS standardized protocols serving georeferenced map data internet.

title: Argentum Package Updates
text: new function download layers Argentum package

what: Download WFS Layers to Folder — argentum_download_layers
title: Download WFS Layers to Folder — argentum_download_layers
text: function downloads WFS layers specified organizations local folder. can download layers organization specific layers name.

title: Download WFS Layers to Folder — argentum_download_layers
code: argentum_download_layers(   organization,   output_dir = file.path(tempdir(), "wfs_layers"),   layer_names = NULL,   format = c("gpkg", "shp", "geojson"),   overwrite = FALSE )

title: Download WFS Layers to Folder — argentum_download_layers
text: organization character string specifying name organization output_dir Path directory files saved. Defaults temporary directory. layer_names Optional vector layer names download. NULL, downloads available layers format Output format files. One "gpkg" (GeoPackage), "shp" (Shapefile), "geojson" (GeoJSON) overwrite Logical; existing files overwritten?

title: Download WFS Layers to Folder — argentum_download_layers
text: Invisibly returns data frame download results

title: Download WFS Layers to Folder — argentum_download_layers
text: Download WFS Layers Folder

what: Get WMS or WFS Capabilities — argentum_get_capabilities
title: Get WMS or WFS Capabilities — argentum_get_capabilities
text: Get WMS WFS Capabilities

title: Get WMS or WFS Capabilities — argentum_get_capabilities
code: argentum_get_capabilities(url, max_tries = 3, timeout = 30)

title: Get WMS or WFS Capabilities — argentum_get_capabilities
text: url full URL WMS WFS service, including parameters max_tries maximum number attempts connect timeout timeout attempt seconds

title: Get WMS or WFS Capabilities — argentum_get_capabilities
text: XML document containing service capabilities

title: Get WMS or WFS Capabilities — argentum_get_capabilities
code: # \donttest{ try({   capabilities <- argentum_get_capabilities("http://example.com/wfs")   print(capabilities) }) #> Requesting capabilities from: http://example.com/wfs #> Attempt 1 failed. Retrying... #> Attempt 2 failed. Retrying... #> Error in value[[3L]](cond) :  #>   Failed to retrieve capabilities after 3 attempts: Could not resolve hostname [example.com]: Could not resolve host: example.com # }

title: Import WFS Layer — argentum_import_wfs_layer
text: Import WFS Layer

title: Import WFS Layer — argentum_import_wfs_layer
code: argentum_import_wfs_layer(wfs_url, layer_name)

title: Import WFS Layer — argentum_import_wfs_layer
text: wfs_url URL WFS service layer_name name layer import

title: Import WFS Layer — argentum_import_wfs_layer
text: sf object

title: Import WFS Layer — argentum_import_wfs_layer
code: # \donttest{ tryCatch({   sf_layer <- argentum_import_wfs_layer("http://example.com/wfs", "example_layer")   print(sf_layer) }, error = function(e) {   message("Error occurred: ", e$message) }) #> Requesting WFS feature from: http://example.com/wfs?service=WFS&version=1.1.0&request=GetFeature&typeName=example_layer&outputFormat=application%2Fjson #> Warning: GDAL Error 1: Could not resolve host: example.com #> Error occurred: Error importing WFS layer: Cannot open "http://example.com/wfs?service=WFS&version=1.1.0&request=GetFeature&typeName=example_layer&outputFormat=application%2Fjson"; The file doesn't seem to exist. # }

title: Download WFS Layers Interactively — argentum_interactive_download
text: function provides interactive interface download WFS layers. Users can select organization, choose specific layers download , specify output format directory.

title: Download WFS Layers Interactively — argentum_interactive_download
code: argentum_interactive_download(output_dir = NULL)

title: Download WFS Layers Interactively — argentum_interactive_download
text: output_dir Optional; Path directory files saved. NULL, user prompted

title: Download WFS Layers Interactively — argentum_interactive_download
text: Invisibly returns data frame download results

title: Download WFS Layers Interactively — argentum_interactive_download

what: List Layers for a Given Organization — argentum_list_layers
title: List Layers for a Given Organization — argentum_list_layers
text: function retrieves lists available layers specified organization.

title: List Layers for a Given Organization — argentum_list_layers
code: argentum_list_layers(organization)

title: List Layers for a Given Organization — argentum_list_layers
text: organization character string specifying name organization

title: List Layers for a Given Organization — argentum_list_layers
text: data frame containing layer information columns 'Name' 'Title'

title: List Layers for a Given Organization — argentum_list_layers
code: # \donttest{ # This example uses a mock organization name. # In a real scenario, use an actual organization name from argentum_list_organizations() tryCatch({   orgs <- argentum_list_organizations()   if(nrow(orgs) > 0) {     layers <- argentum_list_layers(orgs$Name[1])     print(layers)   } else {     message("No organizations found.")   } }, error = function(e) {   message("Error occurred: ", e$message) }) #> Attempting to connect to WFS URL: https://geotematico01.conae.gov.ar/geoserver/wfs?service=WFS&version=1.1.0&request=GetCapabilities #> Requesting capabilities from: https://geotematico01.conae.gov.ar/geoserver/wfs?service=WFS&version=1.1.0&request=GetCapabilities #>                                             Name #> 1         Localidades:Centro_huellas_localidades #> 2           Localidades:Cuyo_huellas_localidades #> 3            Localidades:NEA_huellas_localidades #> 4            Localidades:NOA_huellas_localidades #> 5 Localidades:PatagoniaNorte_huellas_localidades #> 6   Localidades:PatagoniaSur_huellas_localidades #> 7               Localidades:imagenes_disponibles #>                                      Title #> 1          Centro - Huellas de localidades #> 2            Cuyo - Huellas de localidades #> 3             NEA - Huellas de localidades #> 4             NOA - Huellas de localidades #> 5 Patagonia Norte - Huellas de localidades #> 6   Patagonia Sur - Huellas de localidades #> 7                     imagenes_disponibles # }

what: List Organizations with WMS and WFS Services — argentum_list_organizations
title: List Organizations with WMS and WFS Services — argentum_list_organizations
text: List Organizations WMS WFS Services

title: List Organizations with WMS and WFS Services — argentum_list_organizations
code: argentum_list_organizations()

title: List Organizations with WMS and WFS Services — argentum_list_organizations
text: data frame containing organization information including WMS WFS URLs

title: Select Organization — argentum_select_organization
text: Select Organization

title: Select Organization — argentum_select_organization
code: argentum_select_organization(search = NULL, interactive_select = interactive())

title: Select Organization — argentum_select_organization
text: search optional search term filter organizations interactive_select Logical; whether run interactive mode. Defaults interactive()

title: Select Organization — argentum_select_organization
text: data frame containing selected organization's information, NULL selection made

title: Select Organization — argentum_select_organization
